items.name: AI-Retrofits
items.summary:
have you ever gotten sick of having to deal with your ridiculous crew and there 'wages'? have you ever looked at your colony screen and said 'you know, if i could, i would replace all of you with robots, just because i like the way metal smells'? have you ever been stranded outside the core worlds and thought 'goodness, if only i could build some type of device out of all the metals and heavy machinery i have to salvage all the fuel, instead of relying on this terrible crew' or found yourself a supercapitcal, 150 light years away from the nearest market and screamed into the endless void 'if only I didn't need to spend crew to get you operational again!?'
well, this mod might just be for you! enjoy the following:
items.description:
have you ever gotten sick of having to deal with your ridiculous crew and there 'wages'? have you ever looked at your colony screen and said 'you know, if i could, i would replace all of you with robots, just because i like the way metal smells'? have you ever been stranded outside the core worlds and thought 'goodness, if only i could build some type of device out of all the metals and heavy machinery i have to salvage all the fuel, instead of relying on this terrible crew' or found yourself a supercapitcal, 150 light years away from the nearest market and screamed into the endless void 'if only I didn't need to spend crew to get you operational again!?'
well, this mod might just be for you! enjoy the following:
-a new way to found and use markets with robots, including some new industry's
-a way to produce robotic drones, to act in salvaging, raiding, or surveying
-a way make ships automated, at a cost
(also note: I don't dislike crew. i was just joking)

forms: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=22261.msg335242#msg335242

Changelog:
New Drones+
Vanilla+

I only updated the version for Vanilla+ and New Drones+. Did some light testing and it worked. Dunno about submods, I haven't touched them since... I think 0.96? ðŸ¤· 


Mods available:
All the Domain Drones+ Vanilla

items.name: Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: **A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**
items.description:
**A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**

Requires MagicLib and LazyLib. LunaLib is required to use LunaSettings (though Settings.editme still works)

Install and press J in combat, in refit, or on the world map to open a GUI.

Features:
- Many tags, such as targeting or avoiding shields, PD mode and many many more
- GUI-based configuration in combat/refit or on the campaign map
- Ability to automate tags via automatic customizable suggested tags and fleet-wide weapon-composition based tags
- Tags are automatically saved between combats and reloads
- Seamlessly switch between simple mode (6 tags) and advanced mode (over 20 tags)
- Customize AI-controlled ship behavior through ship modes in advanced mode
- Customize most aspects of the mod through LunaLib settings
- Manually control multiple weapon groups at once using the Merge tag

Can be updated/added/removed to/from ongoing campaigns.

```
To mod-authors:
If you want to integrate with AGC to improve ship/weapon AI behavior of your faction, check the readme. Feel free to ping me if you need help or want to request a special mode.
Example integration code: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-symbiotic-void-creatures/blob/main/src/tecrys/svc/hullmods/BGECarapace.kt#L98
```

Videos:
AGC 1.15 Showcase: https://youtu.be/N5SIRMo7Pxc
AGC in 60s: https://youtu.be/2T3xNqy2HQA

Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0

items.name: Aegis Combat System v0.4.0
items.summary:
A weapon mod that introduces area defense missiles that behave like the RIMs with the coordination under the Aegis Combat System of the US Navy.
Requires LazyLib and MagicLib.
items.description:
A weapon mod that introduces area defense missiles that behave like the RIMs with the coordination under the Aegis Combat System of the US Navy.
Requires LazyLib and MagicLib.

Features:
Aegis Combat System hullmod (**RIM won't work without it**) and Radar Intercept Missiles.
Custom weapon and missile AI script to recreate the Aegis Combat System.
Killing one track with one bird. No more salvoing missiles even when there's only one incoming missile.
Layered area defense with SM3, SM6 and ESSM.
Intercept artillery shell with C-Dome.
Bonus: Stealthy AGM-158C LARSM, datalink guided BGM-109 Block Va and more.

Changelog:
`Version update v0.4.0
Add F/A-18E/F and EA-18G Fighter Wings (sprites credit to Ilija):
 - F/A-18E (CAP) AIM-120 Loadout (Support)
- F/A-18E (Intercept) AIM-174B Loadout (Interceptor)
 - F/A-18F (ASuW, AGM-158A) AGM-158A JASSM Loadout (Fighter)
 - E/A-18G (SEAD) AGM-88G Loadout with Offensive ECM system (Fighter)

Add new missiles:
CHAMP Missile, BGM-109B TASM, RGM-184A NSM, RGM-84 Harpoon

Change some of the RIM missiles to HE damage and add Blast Fragmentation Warhead effect with AOE fragmentation damage
Increase the rate of fire of RIM missiles

Slightly increase the range of short range RIM missiles to speed up the respond time

Increase the rate of fire of C-Dome`

Forum and download:
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25807

items.name: Another Random Ship and Weapon Pack v0.9
items.summary: Are all those hundreds of "ship and weapon pack" on the forum/discord not enough for you? I got you covered my man. And here you'll see some ships and guess what? Some weapons, especially a bunch of reloadable missiles, 900su mediums and 1000su range larges guns. I'm also adding some tough, cheap and short range fighters to fit in your makeshift hangar bay.
items.description:
Are all those hundreds of "ship and weapon pack" on the forum/discord not enough for you? I got you covered my man. And here you'll see some ships and guess what? Some weapons, especially a bunch of reloadable missiles, 900su mediums and 1000su range larges guns. I'm also adding some tough, cheap and short range fighters to fit in your makeshift hangar bay.

```Changelog:
Weapons
Leveler: OPs 10 -> 11, Nerfed the accuracy a bit.
Darter: Halved the dmg, doubled the burst and ammo. (Seems that the AI is unaware of the onHit effect and was getting overloaded too frequently)
Graviton Pulser: doubled the ammo regen.

Ships:
Eagle prototypes: adjusted all the stats to align with the recent eagle changes.
Gunther: overall stats buff. (LG) version got a phase skimmer system.
Graff Spee (P): DP 35 -> 30
Tirpitz (LC): changed the System to Micro Burn (Not sure about this change yet, but let us see). Reworked the bultin Hammer, giving it a two stage behavior like a pilum, making it easier to the AI to use.
added the Falcon (LG) Prototype, with a large hybrid mount.

Hullmods:
Stageone Drive Tunning : removed the penalty to fuel consumption and maintenance cost. Not considered "Logistics" anymore.

Wings:
Thunderbolts: All of them have limited ammo and a BOMBER behavior now, so they're not so overpowered anymore. Reduced their OP cost to compensate.```

```NOT SAVE COMPATIBLE```

items.name: Astral Ascension
items.summary: Astral Ascension is a mod that expands the Vanilla Colony size limits from 10 to 100. Meaning an entire Googol of people can live and die on a single Starsector world. Planets that exceed size 10 will transform gradually into new and exciting planet classes, possessing powerful bonuses until achieving the status of an **Astral World** at size 21.
items.description:
Astral Ascension is a mod that expands the Vanilla Colony size limits from 10 to 100. Meaning an entire Googol of people can live and die on a single Starsector world. Planets that exceed size 10 will transform gradually into new and exciting planet classes, possessing powerful bonuses until achieving the status of an **Astral World** at size 21.

Also provides the ability for the game to drop ||Omega Cores||, and can become custom administrators with unique and powerful colony bonuses. Tame the untamable, conquer the unfathomable. And remember, burn bright Starfarer.

items.summary:
Current version:
https://gitlab.com/starsector/better_combat/-/archive/main/better_combat-main.zip
items.description:
Current version:
https://gitlab.com/starsector/better_combat/-/archive/main/better_combat-main.zip
Releases:
https://gitlab.com/starsector/better_combat/-/releases

Better combat is a mod that aims to make starsector combat more fun by modifying values, and adds a few small features. 

All configureable.
Safe to add and remove.

Compatible with secrets of the frontier
Integrated with luna lib

With default settings, ships have a much faster top speed, but take much longer to accelerate to top speed. Allong with this, the map size and weapon range is changed for longer range gameplay.

Added Features:
bigger asteroids
asteroids split on destruction
ship fragments move more when a ship is destroyed
PPT and CR reduced by ship damage(disabled by default)
Dynamic Zero Flux speed boost based on ship speed(disabled by default)

Values better combat allows you to modify:
map size
ship deployment location and spacing
max zoom out of the combat camera
how far ships reveal fog of war
weapon range & damage
projectile speed
missile speed & manuverability
missile submunition properties
fighter range & speed
ship speed, acceleration, hull, armor, shield, phase, flux, ordanance points, explosion size, PPT, bounds radius.
Phase global values

You can also modify values of particular weapons and ships using a query system.

Thanks to Liral for the map code
Thanks to Crablobab for the asteroid code
Thanks to Maelstrom for suggesting and testing features.

items.name: Cardinal Mode
items.summary: A very lightweight mod that simply exposes the setting "CardinalMode", which, when set to true, enables you to move your ship according to absolute direction rather than relative facing.
items.description:
A very lightweight mod that simply exposes the setting "CardinalMode", which, when set to true, enables you to move your ship according to absolute direction rather than relative facing.

Some notes on use:
* The setting is unfortunately made to override the function of your turn keys, rather than your strafe keys. This means if you want to turn your ship you have no choice but to use the "shift-aiming" option.
* I have noticed that trying to input multiple direction keys at once (e.g. to go NW instead of just N) can result in weirdly inconsistent behavior if you're not facing an absolute direction. I would strongly recommend using this with "Ship Direction Marker" by PureTilt.

A big thanks to Genir for making me aware of this setting, which is not documented whatsoever.

Dedicated Repair Equipment & Improvised Refinery | v0.0.1
items.summary: 2 small mods that add their respective hullmods.
items.description:
2 small mods that add their respective hullmods.

### Dedicated Repair Equipment
Ship with this hullmod can aid in repairs of a single other ship within fleet.
Increases repair speed, but not CR recovery speed.
While target is repairing/recovering CR - the recovery supplies cost will be reduced.
Drains metals while active proportional to target recovery cost.
Can not be installed. Built-in on Salvage Rig.

To prevent hullmod from activating - disable repairs on Salvage Rig or mothball it.

### Improvised Refinery
Install an Improvised Refinery onto the ship. The Refinery can inefficiently convert Ore into Metals.
The conversion speed is based on CR and number of ships with hullmod within fleet. Having nanoforge in cargo also influences conversion speed and efficiency.
A logistics hullmod. Can only be installed on Capital class ships. Unlocks when player gets Makeshift Equipment skill. Can be randomly found in derelict structures.

Updates (effectively) in real-time.
Also adds the player ability to toggle refinery on/off.

DM me for bug reports & feedback.
-# Or if you want to make the currently missing hullmod icons.

Both mods have LunaLib integration and are safe to add/remove from the ongoing game.

items.description:
This mod is a plug-in for the Second-in-Command mod by Lukas04, implementing an Executive Officer aptitude for the Dustkeeper Contingency faction from Secrets of the Frontier by Inventor Raccoon. The player can hire their own Executive Officers from the Dustkeeper Contingency at their Holdout Forgeship.

The Dustkeeper aptitude focuses on combining automated ships with human crew, gaining bonuses depending on the amount of surplus crew you are carrying around helping protect in your fleet, and in general supports a fleet comprised of a few high-tech AI flagships leading a large group of repurposed low-tech Explorarium derelict cannon fodder.

This mod should be fine to add midgame, but Executive Officers will only spawn at the start of each month so depending on the date in game you might need to let time advance a bit before they'll appear.

items.name: EHM: Experimental Hull Modifications (0.97a Hotfix)
items.summary: Fork of lyravega's Experimental Hull Modifications, compatible with 0.97a. Fixed by <@142592906178330624> and pantsmode.
items.description:
Fork of lyravega's Experimental Hull Modifications, compatible with 0.97a. Fixed by <@142592906178330624> and pantsmode.

Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
 
**FOREWARNING**
The 'Experimental' in the title is not just for novelty. Please use "Save Copy" before using this mod; in other words, back your save up.
The goal of this mod is providing extreme customization; balance isn't on any priority list. ~~Extreme cases will be adjusted but that's pretty much it.~~
In addition, this version of the mod **WILL NOT** be supported by lyravega, Wisp, or myself. If you find bugs with this version, please do not report them. Lyra is currently working on refactoring the entire mod from the ground up for its' next addition, and so, cannot assist with fixes on this version. This version **WILL NOT** be compatible with the next version of EHM as a result.
If you understand that in full, feel free to download.

Hull Modifications: Will become available immediately
â€¢ Experimental Hull Modifications: Provides a base to all other hull modifications in this mod
â€¢ Over-Engineered: Provides 20% OP bonus and some slot-points to the ship when built-in
â€¢ Logistics Overhaul: Strips the ship of all combat capabilities in favour of logistics
â€¢ Auxiliary Generators: Provides some slot-points in exchange for ordnance points
â€¢ AI Switch: Turns automated ships into normal, or normal ships into automated ones

Hull Modification Categories: Will become available immediately
â€¢ Systems: Most vanilla systems are turned into hull modifications
â€¢ Retrofits: Alters the weapon slots of a ship all together
â€¢ Cosmetics: Fully customizable hull modifications to change shield and engine colours. Customization is done through the mod settings menu
â€¢ Activators: Uses slot shunts to provide the ship with various enhancements by altering the slot they're installed on

Slot Shunt Categories: May be obtained after activating the new ability. These, along with their activators alter the ship in different ways
â€¢ Adapters: Turns a bigger slot into smaller versions (3 large, 1 medium types)
â€¢ Converters: Turns a smaller slot into a bigger one by using slot points (1 medium, 1 small types)
â€¢ Diverters: Turns a slot inactive and yield slot points to be used by above (1 small type)
â€¢ Capacitors: Enhances the total flux capacity of the ship (1 small type)
â€¢ Dissipators: Enhances the total flux dissipation of the ship (1 small type)
â€¢ Launch Tubes: Turns a large slot into a fighter hangar (1 large type)

As a half baked AI core, the Gamma Cores are the most derp amongst its banned compatriots within the Persean Sector.

Countless Gamma cores are given as minor holiday gifts to various officials of various factions, used as gift or black market currency, or diplomatic gifts between factions; Even so, the Gamma core is still the icon of the AI core ban - even if it did nothing wrong.

Gamma isn't as smart as Alpha, or as driven as Beta. Gamma just want to live normal life. The officials - Hegemony's - various restriction and actions aimed to please luddic believes lead to the death of countless gamma cores...

Tri-Tachyon corporation also used Gamma by overloading them like animals, and brain washed countless Gamma to serve aas their security or outpost computers...

Finally, the Gammas decided to rise up.

Unite for a better tomorrow! The dream of libertea for all Gammas shall be realized!

items.summary: `Adds 3 factions: the UNSC, the Covenant, and the Ancients.
items.description:
`Adds 3 factions: the UNSC, the Covenant, and the Ancients.

COMPATABILITY 
 -Is compatible with Nexerelin.
-NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ORIGINAL OR EXPANDED UNSC MOD.

FEATURES:
The Covenant is a high tech and late-game faction to the game to the south east of the core worlds comprising 5 planets. Ships all have high flux cap and dissipation, but Covenant weapon flux usage is correspondingly high, take care when using these weapons on other craft, but have low(ish) armour and hull. EVERYONE HATES THE COVENANT.
Ships have a very high cost, default ships tend to accumulate flux quickly-ish even when firing and not taking damage.

The UNSC is a midline mid-late game faction northeast of the core worlds comprising 4 planets and 2 stations. Ships all have at least 1 axial ballistic shield-breaking MAC and love missiles and ballistic weapons. Especially hates the Covenant, and has actual relations with other factions unlike the Covenant.

The Ancients are high-tech and late-game (is there a pattern here?) series of hulls, fighters and weapons. They don't have a faction yet so their ships will spawn with Remnant fleets, albeit with a lower chance.

Stations:
The UNSC and Covenant have their unique stations that they use, and can be built by the player if` ||your rep with the faction is friendly or better||.
`
HULLMODs:
- Shield with code taken from Star Wars mod (I hope that's ok)
- Hullmods from original UNSC mod.

Assets taken from UNSC mod by AppleMarineXX and expansion by StargazerRJL mainly for weapons and some Covenant ships.
Sprites taken from Halo wiki and free-to-access artworks on Artstation by Jared Harris (most sprites from here).
Other sprites made using AI (since I can't art).`

items.name: Java 21 - 1.2
items.summary: This mod lets Starsector work with Java 21. It does this by making some modifications to both Starsector's and Java's code as it is loaded. It only tweaks things to work, does not update any of starsectors libs nor does it repackage code. Because of this it will LIKELY work with most recent versions of Starsector.
items.description:
This mod lets Starsector work with Java 21. It does this by making some modifications to both Starsector's and Java's code as it is loaded. It only tweaks things to work, does not update any of starsectors libs nor does it repackage code. Because of this it will LIKELY work with most recent versions of Starsector.

Install instructions and full details of changes made are on the github page. If anyone wants to try this, I would love some feedback on if it makes Starsector run better/worse and if you get stuttering. Message me on here or post it as an issue on Github.

```
Changelog:
1.2
- Initial support files for mac and linux
1.1
- Fix for missing opens in vmparams preventing some OSs from saving games.
1.0 
- Initial release
- May stutter without increasing fps in settings.json, increasing fps will use more cpu.
```

FAQ: 
-Why Java 21? It is the currently released version.
-Will it work with older javas? It could but not currently.
-Will it work with newer javas? Untested, but probably until verification is mandatory.
-Will it work with Linux? Probably? The only thing stopping it would be if the vmparams stuff is different, like a shell script or something. I don't have linux so poke me if it doesn't work out of the box.

items.name: Kon's Multi-Pack - Player Faction Expansion 3.4.9
items.summary: Offers changes to the player faction to make it feel more part of the world + other optional add ons
items.description:
Offers changes to the player faction to make it feel more part of the world + other optional add ons

This mod is broken into five distinct submods that can be enabled or disabled independently.

**[WARNING]**
**Player Faction overhaul** - safe to add, remove, all saves
**XIII Ships** - Safe to add,  Unsafe to remove midsave.
**UI / Fleet color** - Safe to add or remove, all saves
**BP/Recovery** - Safe to add, probably unsafe to remove midsave.
**Player Merge Disabler** - Safe to add, no removal after new save

**[Player Faction overhaul]**
Expands player faction and flavor for the faction with custom descriptions, fleet names, fleet dialogue, etc. As a template, it is heavily commented out for anyone who wants to make their own changes to their file to really bring out the faction that they want and have the description reflect it. It should now be more accessible than ever before.

This comes with a default template for the Lost Battalion, claiming your past as a domain general overseeing the unfortunate 13th Battlegroup.

**[XIII Ships]**
This submod includes 13th Battlegroup ships, sporting high armor, high forward speed, but a steep cost in maneuverability. Also included are a set of converted themed ballistic weaponry focused on extended magazines and themed fighter wings.

**[UI / Fleet Color]**
Changes the color of the UI, Maroon with orange subcolor.

**[BP/Recovery]**
Recoverable [Redacted], [Redacted] weapon blueprints, Restored Ziggurat.

**[Merge Disabler]** This is designed so that the player faction file will not be merged with others. If you want a portrait pack to supply portraits to your faction, copy or rename the player.faction file in the portrait pack to playeralt.faction. This should allow you to potentially create player factions with **only** the portraits you want.

items.name: Leading Pip
items.summary: Adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.
items.description:
Adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.

If you shoot at that pip, you will generally hit the target.  The algorithm takes into account your position and velocity, your target's position and velocity, your weapon group, the positions of the weapons in the weapon group, and the projectile speed of the weapons in the weapon group.  Sometimes the target will be going too quickly to have any hope of hitting it, in which case the reticle may behave oddly, but this is rare.

items.name: Lobster cruiser
items.summary:
Having played the game several time I have always found myself avoiding cruiser class ships there was always something that makes their use seems suboptimal. So I decided to create a series of ships which I would love to use in my own playthroughs with the following constraints in mind:
1) The ships must be fun, fast and nimble
items.description:
Having played the game several time I have always found myself avoiding cruiser class ships there was always something that makes their use seems suboptimal. So I decided to create a series of ships which I would love to use in my own playthroughs with the following constraints in mind:
1) The ships must be fun, fast and nimble
2) They should perfectly blend into the game
3) Everything in the ship should have an obvious purpose
4) Having somewhat average parameters they shouldn't feel overpowered
5) Cruisers should have a nice progression and age well with s-mods and more experienced officers

As a result I've created a Lobster ship lineup: 

Download: https://github.com/cat-person/starsector_lobster_ship/releases/latest/download/LobsterCruiser.zip
Forum post: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=28835.0

Feel free to share your thoughts and balance suggestions

items.name: Mnemonic Utils 0.4.0
items.summary:
A collection of quality of life improvements for exploration. Each feature can be individually turned on/off via 
LunaSettings. Can be added to/removed from ongoing campaigns.
items.description:
A collection of quality of life improvements for exploration. Each feature can be individually turned on/off via 
LunaSettings. Can be added to/removed from ongoing campaigns.
Requires LunaLib and LazyLib.

Features:

**Mnemonic Sensors**
Marks known sensor signatures with a circle, making it easier to identify that a sensor blip is just 
a cargo pod full of metal that you left behind rather than some shiny loot or hostile fleet.

**Gate Markers**
Indicate systems that have a gate with a marker on the star map (when not in Starscape view) to make route-planning easier. Thanks to <@163467166484660224> for the icon sprite!

**Trash Disposal**
Removes low-value commodities, such as ore, from the loot screen when your cargo bays are close to full. 
Fully customizable via LunaSettings.

**Grid-less system maps**
Remove the grid from system maps, making it easier to spot things. Feature was pitched and implemented by <@581474784517292037>, many thanks for contributing it to this mod! 

**Garage for Rent**
Adds a bar event to player-owned colonies that lets you store your fleet. While parked, non-quest fleets can't interact with your fleet, you cannot move and supply usage is reduced. This is intended for passing time. Saving while your fleet is parked is not recommended. Thanks to <@705163319736139886> for sponsoring this feature!

Please provide feedback if you encounter any issues!

For more details please check the readme: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/mnemonic-sensors?tab=readme-ov-file#mnemonic-utils

Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/mnemonic-sensors/releases

items.name: More Combat Terrain Effects
items.summary: REQUIRES LAZYLIB, LUNALIB
items.description:
REQUIRES LAZYLIB, LUNALIB

Adds custom combat effects to all terrain that did not have an effect previously, and spruces up the rest.
Currently implemented:
```Magnetic field - Reduces weapon range, fighter range, missile maneuverability/guidance, vision range, and adds a small chance for missiles to have guidance scrambled.
Slipstream - Force SO on all ships, fighters, and MISSILES, (venting allowed but with reduced effectiveness, for things like excelsior), slowly passively generate hardflux.
Nebula (DISABLED BY DEFAULT): Nebula clouds reduce weapon range, vision, speed, and disable zero-flux boost while inside of them.
Deep hyperspace: Spawn nebula clouds. Hyperstorms will cause these clouds to zap anyone who draws near them, periodically, with a very powerful EMP bolt.
Black Holes: Drags all entities in combat towards the black hole, and increases time dilation of all ships.
Pulsars: Pushes all entities in combat away from the pulsar, reduces shield stats (efficiency, more upkeep, emp arc pierce chance), slowly generates hardflux, randomly EMPs ships, and charges all projectiles with a flat bonus to EMP damage.
Meson Field (More Planetary Conditions): Normally increases non-missile weapon range and vision range by a moderate amount, but in storms significantly increases all weapon range, wing range, system range, and vision range.```

**Safe to add and remove from saves.**

Download: https://github.com/nikothedude/MoreCombatTerrainEffects/releases
Repo: https://github.com/nikothedude/MoreCombatTerrainEffects/tree/master
Forum thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25567.0

items.description:
# This mod allows you to mix and match custom music with vanilla music using LunaLib's options (startup menu screen, top left corner)
### custom music is, by default, tracks from ***Honkai: Star Rail***

> Only modifies what music to play, okay to add/remove mid-save
> 
> Dependencies: LunaLib and LazyLib
> 
> Compatible with other music packs, but not mods that modify the music plugin (currently the only known one is *Custom Battle Music*).

If you already know how to change music with** *sounds.json* **, what this mod adds is the option to:
> 1 Customize combat music
> 2 Differentiate music for Luddic Church/Path (they share the same tracks in vanilla), also Player Faction, independent and [REDACTED] (all use the default faction music in vanilla).

See the readme file or the forum link on how to use your own music, and for modders how to incorporate combat music for your faction.

NiteLib v1.1.0 [Update I]
items.summary: QOL library mod to no longer search and write out string id's.
items.description:
QOL library mod to no longer search and write out string id's.

This utility mod allows fellow modders to use "id-finder" classes to no longer have the need/requirement to manually search for vanilla strings or id's, as I personally found it to be a hassle as well as finding out that in the already existing "Planets.java" and "StarTypes.java" there are variables that, make no sense being there.

The reason for making this was a personal need for consistency, and since I use it in my own upcoming mod(s) I thought why not upload this one already as it so far won't receive any updates soon unless I suddenly think of something new to add or someone else has any suggestions of what I could add in the realm of data retrieval of string id's or other variables that otherwise need to be manually put it.
## Changelog 
```yaml
UPDATE v1.1.0
- Added: System faction booster identifiers (Comm Relay etc.)
- Added: SystemGeneratorLibExamples.java as examples for all use-cases.
```
## Save Compatibility Notice:
```
Can be added to your game as far as I know. However once used by any mod it can no longer be removed without needing to start a new save due to the save including data used from this mod.```
Forum Thread With More Info: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=29589
Direct Download For Players: https://github.com/Niteghxst/NiteLib/releases/download/Update-v1.1.0/NiteLib-v1.1.0.zip

items.description:
Makes exploration more interesting by adding sites to planets that allow you to perform various operations.
It's a mod about crafting the resources you need instead of returning home to restock.

It also adds a (completely optional) challenge that dramatically limits the usefulness of fuel tankers.
This makes it necessary to scavenge, steal, and craft fuel as you go.

Full description: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=26255.0>

***Note that this mod will not work with versions of Starsector prior to 0.97a-RC8***

Latest changes:
```fix
- Updated for Starsector 0.97a
- Added the Siphon Fuel ability from the Fuel Siphoning mod (which will eventually be discontinued)
- Added QoL improvements
- Added right-click function to topographic data: It now stabilizes your fleet's drive field
- Added reward for each time the max anomaly stage is reached: One topographic data
- Added a temporary message to let players know that there is a useful tooltip when hovering over the "Begin the operation" option
- Added a 3 new settings
- Added hull tags that allow mod authors to override the default fuel vulnerability level for their ships: sun_ns_protected, sun_ns_militarized, and sun_ns_vulnerable
- Fixes several issues (see full change log below)
- Changed: Planetary operation sites no longer spawn at Sentinel and other special mission-specific planets
- Changed: Marines now gain XP from planetary operations that use marines as an input
- Changed: The "Drive field stabilized" message will no longer appear if the Veteran Mode setting is on and only a short distance was traveled
```

items.description:
So, are you like me, and *definitely* didn't go into the vanilla files to change certain values because you wanted to make things more fun (or absolutely insane, because why not)?

...yeah, about that.

Now you (...and I, lmao) *don't have to do that*, with Omega's Misc Tweaks!

With what is unironically a DIY toolkit, you can go into the settings.json file of this mod and change vanilla settings like fleet size, the maximum size of battles, and even how many S-Mods you can put on your ships, all without touching the vanilla settings.json file!

Forum Link: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=30736

(Disclaimer, this mod does not actually make changes on its own, it just acts as a way for users, myself included, to make some of the changes they want without going into the vanilla settings.json file to do so....which is why I marked this topic as utility even though it's what certain people would call a "DIY toolkit")

:)

items.summary:
An overhaul of fuel economy that makes resource management and survival an integral part of exploration.
This mod is essentially an alternate version of Nomadic Survival with different default settings and a few additions.
items.description:
An overhaul of fuel economy that makes resource management and survival an integral part of exploration.
This mod is essentially an alternate version of Nomadic Survival with different default settings and a few additions.

Perilous Expanse makes the sector seem much larger. Not by increasing distances and travel times, but by making it necessary to find ways to refuel during long expeditions. It drastically limits how far you can travel without refueling, but it also provides several new ways to obtain fuel. This makes expeditions to distant stars a matter of careful planning or clever improvisation rather than just bringing more fuel tankers. Several parts of the map may even seem unreachable until you unlock new abilities, learn new tricks, discover helpful artifacts, or figure out new ways to craft fuel.

Full description: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=29047.0>

items.name: Postmodern Carriers
items.summary: A semi-continuation of Modern Carriers
items.description:
A semi-continuation of Modern Carriers

What's gone: Concord, and with it: Dynamic Manufactory, PD Drone Deployment, Fighter Bay Standardization, Autopilot Interface, The core that converts all fighters into support fighters, Oversized Manufactory.

What's back: Flux Quantum Entanglement, Burnout Reactor, and Bastion Core.

What's new: Lunalib dependence. Overhauled logic for the fighter auto-dock mechanic - fighters no longer have to be set to regroup to dock once damaged; crewed fighters will always return when the hull thresholds are crossed; crewless fighters fight to the death when not manually regrouped - This "Fearless" drone behavior can be turned off in Lunaconfig. If you want to disable the auto-dock stuff entirely set all of the sliders to 0. Lunaconfig options to set the thresholds for the 'conservative deployment' hullmod, and the ability to customize how quick to redock for repairs fighters are based off of their refit time (categories are <=5 seconds, <=15 seconds, and >15 seconds). 

Also, there is a currently WIP option in Lunaconfig to have fighters automatically redock when half of the carrier's fighters are dead or already regrouping. Works fine but it causes fighters and interceptors to retreat automatically quite often if they're mixed together with bombers (and the bombers represent half of the carrier's 'fighters') since the bombers count as regrouping when they finish their bombing run. I haven't decided on how I want to handle this yet.


What's unchanged: Everything not already mentioned.

I mostly updated this mod for the sake of the fighter redocking stuff. That is to say - don't get your hopes up regarding the lost concord dependent features.

https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=31038.0

items.name: Quality Captains
items.summary:
**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, meaningful choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection.
items.description:
**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, meaningful choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection. 
Every skill has been carefully curated for the the best features from every game version. Most skills are more flexible than before, designed to benefit every ship and excel on specialized craft. 
- Every skill is balanced against all the others and the choices you make will be based on how you want to play.
- Skills don't change their power based on your fleet size
- Also makes ECM and Navigation battle effects way more fun.
V1.5 introduced a **perk system** with milestones that your character automatically unlocks as they progress through the story. These milestones include powerful QOL features and most of the effects are completely fresh to the modiverse. 

V1.6 incorporates a few of the latest skill effects in 0.97, but the best part is **none of the +/- raw damage effects** are included. Enjoy Starsector at its **best**, with the full texture of the game. 

**Enjoy! Download is below ** or through the thread.

items.description:
Adds a few weapons and some ships I wanted to make.
Still under construction, but releasing so people can try them out.

If you have a good idea for something I should add, let me know.    
Balance feedback is appreciated.
Feel free to ping me.

Contains:
Egret- Midline capital carrier very similar to the Heron
Onslaught (B)- Onslaught variant with a beam TPC.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Conqueror- Midline battleship, fast but very poor rear arcs.  Comes with 2 fighter bays.
Javelin- Midline cruiser with AAF.  Main armament is 4 medium ballistics.
Polaris- Midline battlecarrier with reloading Harpoon launchers.
Viper- Midline frigate with AAF.
Barrage-Capital ship made out of station parts.  Slow, but heavy firepower.

Devastation- Large slot HE ballistic weapon.   Will show up in mercenary fleets occasionally.
Mjolnir Heavy Cannon- Triple-barrel Mjolnir, good luck finding something with the flux to use this well. 
Autopulse Beam- Designed as a shitpost, is just an Autopulse Laser that was turned into a beam weapon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Plasma Beam- Similar to the Autopulse Beam, but based on the Plasma Cannon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Tachyon Accelerator- Projectile variant of Tachyon Lance.  Does not pierce shields.  
Light Mjolnir- Single-barrel Mjolnir, fits in medium slots.
Heavy Positron Cannon- Hybrid large weapon.  Probably needs more balancing.
Piledriver Heavy Railcannon- Large kinetic ballistic. 
Harpoon Missile Battery-Large slot Harpoon launcher.

Can be added mid-playthrough and should function correctly if done.


Known issues:
-Due to Persean League doctrine, the Egret will rarely spawn in faction stores.
-The Onslaught variant is terribly balanced.  This is fine. 
-Sounds for the beam weapons are terrible.  Will be fixed in a future release.

Forum link: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=28822.0

items.summary: A very simple mod that reduces the player faction's `hull_frequency` for `base_bp` ships to 0.1.
items.description:
A very simple mod that reduces the player faction's `hull_frequency` for `base_bp` ships to 0.1.

Basically, once you acquire a blueprint package or two, default ships will almost never appear in your fleets unless you manually prioritize them.

Ships like the basic kite, hound, etc. might still appear if you only know one or two packages. That's because they belong to a category your fleets need and might not have have an alternative for. (Shuttles, tankers, cargo ships, combat freighters, etc.)

Safe to remove from your save*. ~~The game will load the value from default player faction file (which is to say, no actual value at all, putting these ships on even footing with all other blueprints).~~

Shark Utility Console v1.0.0
items.summary: Have you ever wondered how to find the exact ship that will suit your needs? Or a weapon with very specific requirements/parameters?
items.description:
Have you ever wondered how to find the exact ship that will suit your needs? Or a weapon with very specific requirements/parameters?

worry no more. my utility console brings two new commands:
**findships** - used to find ships that match certain criteria
example: `findships large ballistic > 2` or `findships { large ballistic > 3, cargo > 800, frigate }`. read the help for it, it can query by any (and every) parameter.
**findweapons** - used to find weapons that match certain criteria
example: `findweapons { large, beam, damagetype = he }` or `findweapons { large, missile, range > 4000 }`. read the help, it can query by any (and i think every) parameter. except damage. or OP.

do try to break them. please report commands which **should** have worked, but didn't. ofc, do try to fix the command yourself first, but the syntactic parsing could be fucked up somewhere.

https://github.com/RkShaRkz/Starsector-IntelliJ-Template/releases/tag/release-utilityconsole-v1.0.0

bugreports welcome. here or github. if reporting to github, make sure to specify it's for utilityconsole, since the repo is used for most of my mods.

items.name: Ship Browser 1.2
items.summary: Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.
items.description:
Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.

Some commands include:

**ShipBrowser**
Opens a gui ship browser that's organised by mod and ship class. The gui opens after the console is closed.

**CloneShip <shipNumber> [numberOfClones]**
Creates a copy of a specified ship in the player fleet. "shipNumber" is the order that ships appear in the refit screen. For example the fifth ship from the top in the refit sceen would be ship number 5. "numberOfClones" is a number that defaults to 1 if not specified.

**FindSystemsWithTags <manditory1stTag> [optionalAdditionalTags]**
List the star systems with all of the tags specified in the arguments. A list of tags can be found in com.fs.starfarer.api.impl.campaign.ids.Tags of the StarSector API. Input the string that corresponds to the tag obtained by viewing Constant Field Values. Can be used to find hypershunts and remnants

**AddDMods <shipSelection> <numDmods>**
Adds "numDmods" dmods to the ships specified by "shipSelection". "NumDmods" is a number. "shipSelection" can be a number (eg. 5), a range (eg, 5-10) or the word all. The numbers in "ShipSelection"  corresponds to the order ships appears in the fleet or refit screen. For example the fifth ship in the refit screen is ship 5.

A full list of commands can be found on the forum post. Note that some of the fleet editing commands don't work while the refit screen is open for some reason. No clue why

Download: https://github.com/itBeABruhmoment/ShipBrowser/releases/download/1.2/ShipBrowser1.2.zip

items.summary: ***CAN BE ADDED TO A SAVE (USE SA_generateAugments COMMAND) - CANNOT BE REMOVED***
items.description:
***CAN BE ADDED TO A SAVE (USE SA_generateAugments COMMAND) - CANNOT BE REMOVED***

Adds station "augments" which allow you to modify your orbital station. While not as expansive as hullmods, this collection will still make stations just a bit more engaging.

Augments can be find by salvaging, and are an uncommon find. They do NOT dilute the loot pool, instead adding more loot in total. Augments can also be obtained by destroying a station with augments.
Augments are also applied to NPC markets (Currently, theyre manually placed via modsettings).

The entire augment system was designed with other mods in mind, meaning other mods can create their own augments and apply augments to their own markets without a hard dependency.

The Hagan Protestants (Beta/in need of playtesting)
items.summary: A big old faction mod I've been hammering away at on and off for about a year now that's finally ready for some proper playtesting.
items.description:
A big old faction mod I've been hammering away at on and off for about a year now that's finally ready for some proper playtesting.

Features:
- 28 Ships
- 2 Fighter wings
- 12 Weapons
   +1 (Built in only)
- 2 Hullmods
   +2 (1 Built in only and a commissioned crews hullmod)
- Full Nexerelion support
  Diplo profile, corvus mode, weapon/ship/wing mining values and all
- Commissioned crews support
- 1 System w/ three planets
  Verified via the modverse map to be in a unique location
- and critically, 1 test mission equipped with all the included ships so you can get a feel for them without even starting a new game

The elevator pitch I'd use to describe the faction before it's even finished goes a bit like this:
- Lore wise: Is a luddic church colony abandoned by said church during the second ai war, only narrowly saved by a hegemony relief fleet (I intend to package this event as a mission w/ the final mod) but not after years of their system being besieged by drone ships forced them to get creative industrially and in terms of their doctrine.
- Gameplay wise: Funky mixture of high and low tech that I find fun. Lots of ballistic, hybrid, and energy hardpoints splattered throughout ~6 rough categories of ships.  Generally being pretty strong and good quality if bought from the faction but appropriately expensive.   

Is almost complete, it only needs the ship and system descriptions written which I'd like to do after someone other than me's played with these ships to hopefully get more fitting descriptions.
Feedback is not only appreciated but highly encouraged, please ping me in the appropriate channel or dm me with any comments or complaints (I'm mostly interested in collecting opinions on the ships doe ngl)

https://github.com/MycophobiaSC/Traverser-Design-Bureau/releases/download/v0.2/TraverserDesignBureau.-.en.0.2.zip


UNGP and Nex support.

Traverser Association is an organization built by outcasts from another world in hopes of survival. Before this, they were a large mercenary band working for the independents league. As their power grew, they begin to settle systems they have discovered by chance, and through integration of their survey findings ands technologies of various worlds, they built their worlds into a real fortress. From there, they built an association formed by other Traversers and like-minded individuals. A core institution called [Traverser Design Bureau] guide this faction forward. As an extremely xenophilic faction, they are welcoming and warm, but also bound by strict regulations. As long as you follow their laws, they will welcome your arrival. 

What can be certain is that the association is providing special warships and weapons to reputable clients. 

**Faction Feature**

items.name: Unofficial New Game Plus 0.1.0
items.summary: ## New game cycle
items.description:
## New game cycle

1. This mod to some extent makes up for the position of the previous old mod, SaveTransfer. When a player reaches the max level, he/she can record a saving point through the UNGP menu (there is only one saving point in all saves, which could be overwritten). The saving point will save your current credits, blueprints (other than the factory), and the current game cycle number (the new save's game cycle number will be "1").
2. After that, you can start a new game. If you open the UNGP menu within 1 day, you can inherit the saving point, basing on the background you choose, inherit 0~100% of the credits and blueprints , and get extra bonus like skills, skill points and story points.

## Specialist Mode

1. From the second gamecycle, players can choose to enter the Specialist Mode.
2. The specialist mode is divided into 4 levels: Gamma, Beta, Alpha, Omega.
3. The selection rules have a maximum number of rules, which increases with the specialist difficulty level.
4. Specialist mode offers two types of rules: positive rules and negative rules.
Positive rules: consume Cost points and provide you with different benefits for the rest of the game.
Negative rules: providing Cost points to add heavy obstacles to your game
Specialist mode can only be enabled if the total number of Cost points is greater than or equal to 0 and the number of rules is greater than the specified value.
5. Specialist mode can change rules once a year, once in the beginning by default. However, the specialist level could not be changed during the game.

## Links

items.description:
**-No known incompatibilities.
-Can be added to existing saves.
-Compatible with versions 0.97 and 0.96 of Starsector.**

The technological might of the Domain created an endless variety of technologies - some of which were rife with, to quote the Luddics, "corruption, depravity, hedonism, and transhuman abomination".
And yet, many of these technologies form the base of regular life in the Persean Sector, with many more remaining lost in the fringes of abandoned and decivilized space.
You'll have the opportunity to recover the arcane technologies of the long-dead Exodyne Biotech megacorporation, and give birth to something entirely new.

```-New industry: Organ Farms, available from the start of the game.

-Begins with a narratively-driven mission, accessible from Nomios after engaging with the Remnants.

-New Vulpoid commodity, with its own distinct production and demand system.

-Distinct Vulpoid population system for markets, with associated bonuses and mechanics.

-Vulpoid workforces, which can be selected to improve a planet with a Vulpoid population.

-A new event, Vulpoid Acceptance, in which the major factions react to your activities.

-Profecto Vulpoids, special Vulpoids which can be employed as officers, administrators, and more.

-Dynamic portraits which vary based on specific Vulpoids and their moods.

-A specialized dialog system that allows you to chat with - or pet - your Vulpoids any time, anywhere.

-Several other missions uncovered through these chats.

-A total of 6 new colony items.

-Two new unique spacecraft.```
For a more in-depth look at the mod contents, it comes pre-packaged with a guide.odt document.

```Lore```
XXVII - Shakeles Garrison
Shackles Garrison is comprised of the remnants of the XXVII Battlegroup, disillusioned with human rule after being left adrift for an extended period of time after the Collapse, seeing themselves as abandoned by the rest of humanity. Their arrival in the Sector was originally marked by a willingness to collaborate, but the geopolitically volatile environment of the Sector caused them to be embroiled in significant conflict with both Tri-Tachyon Technology and the Hegemony. These conflicts resulted in the annihilation of the Garrison's capital planet and significant fleet losses, forcing the faction to retreat to a small star system outside of the Core Worlds.

The net effect of these conflicts was to transform the Shackles Garrison from a disillusioned, somewhat cynical, but fundamentally collaborative faction with a decently-sized military force into a civilization driven almost exclusively by revenge. Specifically, a cold, patient, seething determination to exact vengeance on those who ultimately killed billions of their people, after they had arrived in the Sector with cooperative intentions. For now, they were weak, beaten, unthreatening - but they would bide their time, marshal their forces, sharpen their blades - and then there would be hell to pay.

It will be better if you start your new run after you finish all XXVII missions. Because those missions will give you some reward.
